channel.title: Jagex Trolling us
channel.description:
Did some snooping around, a lot of people seem to think this "Bring back the wilderness & Free trade!" Is a sham. I am starting to think so aswell, it's fishy that you can vote more then one time with the same or a different account, you can put in "Zezima" and it'd work, or "Mod Mmg". A lot of rumors are they are going for another world record, which one? I am unsure. They've won several in the past and they even mention it in the post
The Jagex family has grown to well over 400, we’ve picked up a number of Guinness World Records along the way (and counting), and for the second year running we’ve won the Golden Joystick Awards as best UK developer.
Seems to me they said "and counting" is this another world record of some sort? They've fucked with us so much in the past I am starting to think they are just fucking us over, if they aren't they still are trolling us. With their release of StelarDawn coming out within a year they may be trying to keep their nasty addicted players to RuneScape and make a whole new community on StellarDawn. Here is 1 video that really convinced me, I'm sure there are more out there. Just look for yourself. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rKa4j-8O5oQ

item.title: Jagex Trolling us
item.dc:creator: @flj0yter0p flj0yter0p
item.description:
@flj0yter0p wrote:

Their explanation about the Guinness World Records at the bottom:
http://www.webcitation.org/5v9QLK2vh

I hope they’re speaking the truth.

Well I say just vote if you want to get it back and just wait, there’s nothing else left to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex Trolling us
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

They choose their words carefully:

Please register your vote if you want to see the return of free trade and the danger of the original wildy. 100,000 votes certainly won't be enough. Perhaps not even 1,000,000. It will take you and every one of your friends, ex-friends and probably even enemies to register sufficient votes to bring it back.

They dont give an exact amount.

If they are trolling, they will lose a massive player base, again.

They wont cope tbh

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex Trolling us
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:6, topic:374439”][quote author=RuneSpace link=topic=470416.msg3439640#msg3439640 date=1293001282]
Explain how it would decrease their playerbase? Alot of players left after this shitty update in '07…
[/quote]

if they work up the commotion and get so many votes etc and then decide not to re-instate wildy and free trade, they will lose more players.[/quote]
They would have to be complete retards not to do this, with all this built up. Wait a minute…
But just think almost 4 years ago, jagex destroyed their golden age, right now, their company is on the line, they dont reinstate it, or lie, MMG can kiss his money jacuzzi good bye

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex Trolling us
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:20, topic:374439”][quote author=merk n a box link=topic=470416.msg3439945#msg3439945 date=1293026298]

Q&A Thread: 15-16-179-62043182

It’s a quickfind code.

a jmod is answering.

  1. Why aren’t the votes verified? Is this an oversight?
  • I currently don’t have an answer for this yet.

chew on that…
[/quote]
The names you put in don’t mean squat apparently. It’s just for aesthetics, so you can see who has recently voted at the side of the page.
Every name that is typed in will be entered into a database table that only allows that username to be added once from any given IP address (well at least this is the approach I would use). They will then determine the validity of the vote by ensuring that the IP address that the vote originated from is also an IP address that has logged into the account at some stage.

Suffice it to say that the votes are verifiable.[/quote]

I heard they arent doing anything whatsoever to log the accounts/ips voted with them.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

OP is right, this is a little bit fishy

item.title: Jagex Trolling us
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“merk n a box, post:18, topic:374439”][quote author=flj0yter0p link=topic=470416.msg3439921#msg3439921 date=1293024065]
Q&A Thread: 15-16-179-62043182

It’s a quickfind code.

a jmod is answering.
[/quote]

  1. Why aren’t the votes verified? Is this an oversight?
  • I currently don’t have an answer for this yet.

chew on that…[/quote]
The names you put in don’t mean squat apparently. It’s just for aesthetics, so you can see who has recently voted at the side of the page.
Every name that is typed in will be entered into a database table that only allows that username to be added once from any given IP address (well at least this is the approach I would use). They will then determine the validity of the vote by ensuring that the IP address that the vote originated from is also an IP address that has logged into the account at some stage.

Suffice it to say that the votes are verifiable.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex Trolling us
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

When I first got membership it was $5 a month, then after time I ended my membership, when I went back it was $7 a month, that was after FunOrb, cause it was joint membership, now it’s $5 a month for RuneScape or $7 a month for both Runescape and FunOrb.

The way I am looking at it now is, they get paid like… 2 cents per page view, and they are shooting for 1 million views, plus this is going to bring back more members plus people are going to make multiple accounts members to transfer over items. So overall they are going to make a nice Christmas bonus out of this. I see them making at least 1-3 million USD if they go through with this, not to mention if this is a Guinness World Record, they will get free advertisement causing more people to play their game. No matter what happens this is getting them players.

Read full topic
